newsitem.title: HONG KONG: HK legislators allowed to protest during handover.
newsitem.headline: HK legislators allowed to protest during handover.

text.p: Pro-democracy legislators who lose their jobs when Hong Kong reverts to Chinese rule next week will be allowed to stage a protest in the assembly during the handover ceremonies, an official statement said on Saturday.
The pro-democracy legislators have refused to take part in the new 60-member assembly which has been appointed by Beijing and will be sworn in on July 1.

The Democratic Party lawmakers will be allowed to enter the legislative building in the early hours of July 1 to read their protests "for a reasonable amount of time", a statement by the secretariat of the provisional pro-Beijing assembly said.
While the Democrats read their protests, the new assembly will be sworn in at a nearby convention centre. The ceremony will come shortly after Britain cedes its former colony to China.
The statement said the compromise had been worked out in conjunction with Tung Chee-hwa, Hong Kong's chief executive-designate.
